Zgodan zagrebački dečko, dvadesetpetogodišnjak, ali neodgovoran, sklon porocima, ukratko, loš karakter lepog lica. S druge strane, nalazi se porodica bankara Maksa Lovreka (Ante Čedo Martinić), koji Jurakovoj firmi daje veliki kredit za preuzimanje malotrgovinskog lanca. On i Tomislav Jurak (ne)prijatelji su još od falultetskih dana. Uz posao, Jurakovi i Lovrekovi povezani su i privatno, a razdoblje prividnog prijateljstva s početka priče ubrzo prerasta u suparništvo. Max Lovrek oženjen je Vesnom Lovrek (Barbara Vicković), ženom sumnjivog karaktera, koja je pritom Maksu neverna. Bankar Lovrek iz prvog braka ima sina Svena (Sven Madžarević), 2o godišnjaka, prilično povučenog, skromnog dečka. Maks kuje zaveru protiv Juraka s Jurakovim ambicioznim sinom Ivanom. Treća glavna ekipa su bolesna majka Dunja (Nada Gačešić Livaković) i njen sin Luka (Damir Markovina), pametan i obrazovan mladić koji neumorno radi kod Jurakovih, ali ne razume da ga oni iskorištavaju. Ima i razloga za slepilo: voli Jurakovu ćerku, Doru. Njihovu vezu Tomislav Jurak nikad ne bi dopustio...

programme.title: Ljubav i mržnja
programme.desc: Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe... Lazarevići su članovi beogradskog "visokog društva" i predstavljaju osim svojih indvidualnostima ono što takvo društvo kod nas podrazumijeva: ljubav, spletke, sreću, nevolje, generacijske sukobe, mržnju. Sve ovo je ipak protkano životom i nenametljivim humorom uz blagu ironiju. Serija "Ljubav i mržnja" zamišljena je u najboljem maniru američke obiteljske serije, sa naizgled definiranim ali zamršenim i nedpredvidivim odnosima između njenih aktera. Tako se ova serija sa svim svojim zavrzlamama kako novac nije garancija za zdravlje i sreću, ali da ga je vrlo lijepo imati i prije svega prikazivati. Cilj serije je da zabavi da gledatelje veže za svoj sadržaj i da prije svega traje.

programme.title: Naša mala redakcija
programme.desc: U ovoj humorističkoj seriji, pratimo zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u jednoj novinskoj redakciji. U ovoj humorističkoj seriji, pratimo zgode i nezgode zaposlenih u jednoj novinskoj redakciji.

programme.title: Kafanica blizu SiS-a
programme.desc: Domaća serija Kafanica blizu SIS-a je humoristička serija koja govori o jednoj firmi iz Vlasotinaca, koja se bavi rešavanjem raznih problema koje klijenti svakodnevno imaju. Domaća serija Kafanica blizu SIS-a je humoristička serija koja govori o jednoj firmi iz Vlasotinaca, koja se bavi rešavanjem raznih problema koje klijenti svakodnevno imaju. Gazda firme je cicija i na sve načine izbegava troši pare. Gazda je Spiridon Don Karamarković, čija je desna ruka sestrić Mulja, a tu je i pomoćnica Roza, koja je glavna kada Spiridona nema.

programme.title: M(j)ešoviti brak
programme.desc: Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Serija "M(j)ešoviti brak" snimljena je na osnovu istoimene pozorišne predstave koja spada među najgledanije poslednjih godina. Naravno, dodati su novi likovi, proširena je priča, a gastarbajterska porodica Čađenovic vratila se u novu državu, Srbiju i Crnu Goru. Čuli su za promene, pa su odlučili da posle više godina boravka u Lucernu, u Švajcarskoj, teško zarađene devize ulože u bisnis u Beogradu. Sasvim slucajno, prvi kadrovi ove serije snimljeni su u državi koja se zvala Jugoslavija, a prva epizoda završena je u državi, koja se poput ovog mešovitog braka Crnogorca i Srpkinje, zove Srbija i Crna Gora.

credits.actor: Danijela Vranješ, Ana Stefanović, Ivana Mihić, Slobodan Stefanović, Goran Jevtić

programme.title: Premijer
programme.desc: Formira se nova vlada Srbije, godina je 2015.! Budući Premijer je narodski čovjek. Formira se nova vlada Srbije, godina je 2015.! Budući Premijer je narodski čovjek. Prije političkog angažiranja, malo je bio poznat u narodu, bavio se književnošću i narodnim umotvorinama. Čak ni televizija koja 2015. godine objavljuje rezultate izbora nije imala njegovu sliku. Međutim, kada je postao premijer, malo-pomalo, bivao je simpatičan običnom narodu. Umjesto napisanih političkih govora, on je govorio prosto, služeći se izrekama i tako postao vrlo popularan lik, omiljen u narodu. PREMIJER je sitkom serija na temu lica i naličja politike i političara. Junaci PREMIJERA iza viskokih državnih funkcija kriju ljudske mane i vrline, i mi pokušavamo, u neskrivenom nušićevskom maniru, da iznesemo pred gledatelji smiješnu a ponekad i gorku stranu osobnosti onih koji odlučuju o sudbini naroda i zemlje.

programme.title: Vila Marija
programme.desc: Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je... Porodici Jurak nacionalizovan je veći deo imovine nakon Drugog svetskog rata, ali svejedno nisu ostali siromašni. Stanuju u dobrom zagrebačkom kvartu. Tomislav Jurak (Žarko Radić) je pedesetogodišnjak, vodi porodični biznis koji uključuje lanac restorana i hotel u centru grada, koji je počeo da gradi još u vreme socijalizma, ali ga je u vlasništvo preuzeo tokom privatizacije devedesetih novcem svoje tete Mitzy. Njegova žena Ana Jurak (Ksenija Pajić), u ranim četrdesetim, rodila mu je dvoje dece- Ivana i Doru. Ana je napustila studije prava kad ga je upoznala i posvetila se brizi o porodici i uz pomoć kućne pomoćnice, brizi o samoj sebi-shopping, bazen i tračanje, omiljene su joj obaveze. Kako god bilo, ona je u svakom slučaju temelj familije. Ćerka Dora (Jelena Veljača) ima 20 godina i studira ekonomiju. Otac je obožava i ne prihvata činjenicu da je već odavno došla u godine da ima dečka i svoju intimu. Razmažena tatina kćer. Ivan (Mislav Čavajda) radi s ocem u firmi. Zgodan zagrebački dečko, dvadesetpetogodišnjak, ali neodgovoran, sklon porocima, ukratko, loš karakter lepog lica. S druge strane, nalazi se porodica bankara Maksa Lovreka (Ante Čedo Martinić), koji Jurakovoj firmi daje veliki kredit za preuzimanje malotrgovinskog lanca. On i Tomislav Jurak (ne)prijatelji su još od falultetskih dana. Uz posao, Jurakovi i Lovrekovi povezani su i privatno, a razdoblje prividnog prijateljstva s početka priče ubrzo prerasta u suparništvo. Max Lovrek oženjen je Vesnom Lovrek (Barbara Vicković), ženom sumnjivog karaktera, koja je pritom Maksu neverna. Bankar Lovrek iz prvog braka ima sina Svena (Sven Madžarević), 2o godišnjaka, prilično povučenog, skromnog dečka. Maks kuje zaveru protiv Juraka s Jurakovim ambicioznim sinom Ivanom. Treća glavna ekipa su bolesna majka Dunja (Nada Gačešić Livaković) i njen sin Luka (Damir Markovina), pametan i obrazovan mladić koji neumorno radi kod Jurakovih, ali ne razume da ga oni iskorištavaju. Ima i razloga za slepilo: voli Jurakovu ćerku, Doru. Njihovu vezu Tomislav Jurak nikad ne bi dopustio...

programme.title: Just Go with It
Moja lažna žena
programme.desc: Directed by Dennis Dugan. With Adam Sandler, Jennifer Aniston, Brooklyn Decker, Nicole Kidman. On a weekend trip to Hawaii, a plastic surgeon convinces his loyal assistant to pose as his soon-to-be-divorced wife in order to cover up a careless lie he told to his much-younger girlfriend.

programme.title: Prebrzi i prežestoki
programme.desc: Kad ga prijatelj Tej ("Ludacris"), mehaničar skupocjenih i izuzetno brzih automobila, obavijesti da se na gradskim ulicama održava još jedna noćna utrka, Brian O'Conner (Walker) pristane sudjelovati. Kad ga prijatelj Tej (C. "Ludacris" Bridges), mehaničar skupocjenih i izuzetno brzih automobila, obavijesti da se na gradskim ulicama održava još jedna noćna utrka, Brian O'Conner (P. Walker) bez razmišljanja pristane sudjelovati. On je bivši detektiv iz Los Angelesa i ljubitelj brze vožnje koji je izbačen iz službe te se preselio u Miami gdje živi od sudjelovanja u ilegalnim automobilskim utrkama. Kad lako pobijedi i u ovoj utrci, u kojoj snage odmjeri i s atraktivnom Suki (D. Aoki) i energičnim Orange Juliusom (A. Nolasco), Brian među okupljenim gledateljima uoči privlačnu Hispanoamerikanku (E. Mendes). Kad ga policijski agenti Markham (J. Remar) i Bilkins (T. Barry) privedu na razgovor, Brian dozna da je djevojka koju je primijetio agentica Monica Fuentes, koja se uspjela ubaciti u zločinačku organizaciju Cartera Veronea (C. Hauser). Verone je narko-diler koji ilegalne automobilske utrke koristi za pranje novca, a Monica je uspjela postati njegova osoba od povjerenja. Pristavši sudjelovati u akciji Veroneova uhićenja, Brian uspije Markhama i Bilkinsa privoljeti da mu kao partnera angažiraju Romana Pearcea (T. Gibson), njegovog starog znanca i vještog vozača. Kad ih Monica nedugo potom predstavi Veroneu i njegovim ljudima Enriqueu (M. Gallini) i Robertu (R. Sanchez), momci zaključe da je pred njima opasan zadatak...

credits.actor: Chris Rock, Rosario Dawson, Gabrielle Union, Cedric the Entertainer, Kevin Hart, Adam Sandler, Ben Vereen, Whoopi Goldberg

the faith","reviewBody":"Baseball and submarines: American cinema seems to thrive in these two arenas. Baseball may be a minor sport globally, its rules lost on the vast majority of Europeans, Africans and Asians, but in cinema it lends itself perfectly to myth and grand narrative. Pragmatic GM Billy Beane comes across a nerdy Peter Brand who seems to have worked out an algorithm to get the most effective baseball squad for the lowest cost. This is just what the cash-strapped Oakland franchise needs, decides Beane. Philosophy meets strategy in a perfect pairing, as Billy and Peter go to work implementing 'moneyball' with an almost religious zeal. Pitt brings his now taken-for-granted charisma and complexity to Beane. The casting of Jonah Hill is a gamble that pays off as he manages to give Peter a backbone, when it would be all too easy to lampoon this character. And when you have Philip Seymour Hoffman stepping up to play a small but crucial part, then you have a movie that is intriguing and compelling in equal measure. Very few people have the courage to choose a transgressive path, and of those that do, fewer still will stick with it in the face of adversity. A film of quiet determination, with occasionally explosive conflict, it is at all times humane and authentic. One to watch again and again.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":380908,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: High Crimes
Zaboravljeni zločin
programme.desc:
High Crimes: Directed by Carl Franklin. With Ashley Judd, Morgan Freeman, Jim Caviezel, Adam Scott. High powered lawyer Claire Kubik finds her world turned upside down when her husband, who she thought was Tom Kubik, is arrested and is revealed to be Ron Chapman. Chapman is on trial for a murder of Latin American villagers while he was in the Marines. Claire soon learns that to navigate the military justice system, she'll need help from the somewhat unconventional Charlie Grimes; meanwhile, Claire's sister, Jackie, is falling in love with wet-behind-the-ears Lieutenant Embry assigned as the official defense lawyer. The whole story revolves around one question: did he do it or is he innocent?

That question keeps the viewer guessing for much of the film and provides some very good suspense. It's another film, however, in which there is a strong anti-U.S. military flavor, so typical in films since the 1960s. 

Also, once you know the ending, I doubt if this would be a movie you would watch more than once. However, it's definitely worth a look and will entertain you for about two hours. Ashley Judd, Jim Caviezel and Morgan Freeman are three attractive lead actors, all interesting to watch, as usual.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40112,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Days
Put oko svijeta u 80 dana
programme.desc: Around the World in 80 Days: Directed by Frank Coraci. With Jackie Chan, Steve Coogan, Cécile de France, Robert Fyfe. To win a bet, an eccentric British inventor, beside his Chinese valet and an aspiring French artist, embarks on a trip full of adventures and dangers around the world in exactly eighty days." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0327437/","name":"Around the World in 80 Days","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4MTkxMjQ2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzE0NzUyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000329/","name":"Jackie Chan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176869/","name":"Steve Coogan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000980/","name":"Jim Broadbent"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0178997/","name":"Frank Coraci"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073388/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0107034/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0894523/","name":"Jules Verne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0864435/","name":"David N. Titcher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0073026/","name":"David Benullo"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Around the World in 80 Days (2004)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1927086361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGZkNTkzZjYtNjQyMC00MGZlLWEyMTEtZDM2NWVkM2FhNDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGZkNTkzZjYtNjQyMC00MGZlLWEyMTEtZDM2NWVkM2FhNDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"CT #2, post"},"datePublished":"2004-09-22","description":"To win a bet, an eccentric British inventor, beside his Chinese valet and an aspiring French artist, embarks on a trip full of adventures and dangers around the world in exactly eighty days.","keywords":"victorian era,queen victoria,one against many,journey,inventor","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0327437/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Elgroovio"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not worth seeing","reviewBody":"The thing about the original "Around the World in 80 Days that made it so enjoyable was the fact that you could spot tons famous actors in cameos. But this this bleak remake has little to recommend apart from Jackie Chan's amazing martial arts moves. Arnold Schwarzannegar (how the hell do you spell it?) plays a prince in Turkey and is just plain embarassing, and I like him as an actor. John Cleese appears for little more time in this film than he did in the first Harry Potter film, and Macy Gray also makes a bizarre cameo appearance as a sleeping French woman. She must have wanted more after "Spider man". Steve Coogan is no David Niven, and he just doesn't have enough charm to keep this film going. But Cecile DeParis is the worst of all. The only good thing in this film apart from Jackie Chan is Rob Schneider as a tramp. You might like it but I think it's pretty mediocre. 6/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":86330,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Put oko svijeta u 80 dana
programme.desc: Godina je 1872. Passepartout (Jackie Chan) ukrade vrijedan kipić Bude i dosjeti se poći na put s ekscentričnim izumiteljem iz Londona, Phileasom Foggom (Steve Coogan) kako bi pobjegao goniteljima. Trka počinje 23. svibnja u 20 sati!Godina je 1872. Passepartout (Jackie Chan) ukrade vrijedan kipić Bude i dosjeti se poći na put s ekscentričnim izumiteljem iz Londona, Phileasom Foggom (Steve Coogan) kako bi pobjegao svojim goniteljima. Naime, Phileas Fogg se okladio sa svojim kolegama iz kluba za džentlmene da može obići svijet u svega 80 dana koristeći razna prijevozna sredstva od vlaka, broda, balona pa do slona. Na putu Passeparttout koristi svoja umijeća borilačkih vještina kako bi zaštitio šefa, a osobito velika opasnost prijeti od osobe koja ih slijedi od samog početka puta, no nitko ne zna o kome se radi.

credits.actor: Jason Segel, Susan Sarandon, Steve Zissis, Ed Helms, Judy Greer, Rae Dawn Chong, Evan Ross, Lance E. Nichols

programme.title: High Crimes
Zaboravljeni zločin
programme.desc:
High Crimes: Directed by Carl Franklin. With Ashley Judd, Morgan Freeman, Jim Caviezel, Adam Scott. High powered lawyer Claire Kubik finds her world turned upside down when her husband, who she thought was Tom Kubik, is arrested and is revealed to be Ron Chapman. Chapman is on trial for a murder of Latin American villagers while he was in the Marines. Claire soon learns that to navigate the military justice system, she'll need help from the somewhat unconventional Charlie Grimes; meanwhile, Claire's sister, Jackie, is falling in love with wet-behind-the-ears Lieutenant Embry assigned as the official defense lawyer. And most of the eyewitnesses have rather too conveniently died." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0257756/","name":"High Crimes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM3MDkyNDMyMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMDI3Nzc3._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001029/","name":"Jim Caviezel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000151/","name":"Morgan Freeman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000171/","name":"Ashley Judd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002083/","name":"Carl Franklin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277511/","name":"Joseph Finder"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0954693/","name":"Yuri Zeltser"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0081060/","name":"Grace Cary Bickley"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"High Crimes","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi195887385","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjMwMDAxM2QtMWUyMS00YWM2LThhMDctODFiZDA0MjQ4ZmZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjMwMDAxM2QtMWUyMS00YWM2LThhMDctODFiZDA0MjQ4ZmZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"datePublished":"2002-09-25","description":"High powered lawyer Claire Kubik finds her world turned upside down when her husband, who she thought was Tom Kubik, is arrested and is revealed to be Ron Chapman. The whole story revolves around one question: did he do it or is he innocent?

That question keeps the viewer guessing for much of the film and provides some very good suspense. It's another film, however, in which there is a strong anti-U.S. military flavor, so typical in films since the 1960s. 

Also, once you know the ending, I doubt if this would be a movie you would watch more than once. However, it's definitely worth a look and will entertain you for about two hours. programme.title: Bat*21
Bat 21
programme.desc:
Bat*21: Directed by Peter Markle. With Gene Hackman, Danny Glover, Jerry Reed, David Marshall Grant. During the Vietnam War, Colonel Hambleton's aircraft is shot down over enemy territory and a frantic rescue operation ensues." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0094712/","name":"Bat*21","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDRmNjYwZDktOTYxZi00MTdlLWI5ZjYtYWU4MDE5MDc5NGM3L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQzNDI3NzY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","War"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000418/","name":"Danny Glover"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0715274/","name":"Jerry Reed"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548533/","name":"Peter Markle"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0115727/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030093/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027587/","name":"William C. Anderson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330207/","name":"George Gordon"}],"datePublished":"1988-10-21","description":"During the Vietnam War, Colonel Hambleton's aircraft is shot down over enemy territory and a frantic rescue operation ensues.","keywords":"helicopter,vietnam,vietnam war,rescue,pilot","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0094712/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jotix100"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bird dog to the rescue","reviewBody":"Never saw this film when it was released originally in 1988. Not knowing what to expect, we decided to take a chance watching it on cable when it was shown the other night; it was a complete surprise. Director Peter Markle, working with a magnificent cast, headed by Gene Hackman and Danny Glover, does wonders to recreate this story of valor under the worst possible circumstances.

The cinematography is excellent. The film relies on visual effects, that are not to be confused with the incredible special effects that we have seen in other movies. Yes, of course, we all know that they are special, but the movie relies in the interplay between the missing Col. Hambleton on the ground and Capt. "Bird Dog" Clark who had the courage to stay focused, first in his plane, and later in the helicopter as he searches for this man, who he didn't even know. 

It's a tribute that these two military men in caring for one another in a difficult situation. Gene Hackman is an actor that always project convincing character. His take on the colonel is the real thing. Danny Glover, on the other hand, is on target. He demonstrates he has what it takes to hold it against big stars, like Mr. Hackman, or in his films with Mel Gibson. He is a joy to watch in his portrayal of a man who is an honest professional.

For fans of action war movies, this is a more real approach to the genre thanks to the vision of its director Peter Markle.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8204,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

During the Vietnam War, Colonel Hambleton's aircraft is shot down over enemy territory and a frantic rescue operation ensues." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0094712/","name":"Bat*21","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDRmNjYwZDktOTYxZi00MTdlLWI5ZjYtYWU4MDE5MDc5NGM3L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQzNDI3NzY@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","War"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000432/","name":"Gene Hackman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000418/","name":"Danny Glover","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0715274/","name":"Jerry Reed"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548533/","name":"Peter Markle"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005883/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0115727/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030093/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027587/","name":"William C. Anderson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0330207/","name":"George Gordon"],"datePublished":"1988-10-21","description":"During the Vietnam War, Colonel Hambleton's aircraft is shot down over enemy territory and a frantic rescue operation ensues.","keywords":"helicopter,vietnam,vietnam war,rescue,pilot","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0094712/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jotix100","dateCreated":"2004-12-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bird dog to the rescue","reviewBody":"Never saw this film when it was released originally in 1988. Not knowing what to expect, we decided to take a chance watching it on cable when it was shown the other night; it was a complete surprise. Director Peter Markle, working with a magnificent cast, headed by Gene Hackman and Danny Glover, does wonders to recreate this story of valor under the worst possible circumstances.

The cinematography is excellent. The film relies on visual effects, that are not to be confused with the incredible special effects that we have seen in other movies. Yes, of course, we all know that they are special, but the movie relies in the interplay between the missing Col. Hambleton on the ground and Capt. "Bird Dog" Clark who had the courage to stay focused, first in his plane, and later in the helicopter as he searches for this man, who he didn't even know. 

It's a tribute that these two military men in caring for one another in a difficult situation. Gene Hackman is an actor that always project convincing character. His take on the colonel is the real thing. Danny Glover, on the other hand, is on target. He demonstrates he has what it takes to hold it against big stars, like Mr. Hackman, or in his films with Mel Gibson. He is a joy to watch in his portrayal of a man who is an honest professional.

For fans of action war movies, this is a more real approach to the genre thanks to the vision of its director Peter Markle.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8204,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5,"duration":"PT1H45M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:

of an Alabama man with an IQ of 75, whose only desire is to be reunited with his childhood sweeth","keywords":"vietnam war,amputee,war hero,based on book,based on novel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109830/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Zonieboy"},"dateCreated":"2002-04-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"A beautiful fable for now and the future","reviewBody":"I believe everyone has a right to their opinion about films or other topics. However from a lot of the comments I have read about this film, I do not think many got the gist of the message from the author and the film maker. This film is a great modern fable, a fable in the dictionary is defined as a brief fictitious story that teaches a moral. There are many morals defined in this film but foremost is integrity and a simple goodness.

I have a half brother who grew up in the Southern U.S. and on one occasion we were discussing this film and he said he felt it portrayed Southerners as dimwitted. I disagreed with him and informed him that the author himself was a native Southerner. The setting is central to this story in that it lets the tale unfold tying in factual events with the fable before us.

The film is wonderfully directed by Robert Zemeckis, the film is his opus and is acted by a great cast on all levels. From the children who were Forrest Gump and Gump Jr. by Haley Joel Osment. Say what you want but I feel Tom Hanks deserved the Oscar award. Gary Sinise is synonymous with Lt.Dan whenever you hear those words. Sally Fields is the loving dutiful mother in her challenging situation. Mykelti Williamson as Bubba gives you a real sense in the story that Gump had a genuine friend, he moves you with his character. Words don't grasp the full performance of Robin Wright Penn as Jenny. Jennys' tenderness and pain are palpable as exhibited by Wright.

I feel that much of Gumps' appeal is his downright sense of doing the right thing regardless of the people and situations around him and we see that in this film. That being the case maybe we all wish we could be just a little more like that, trying to maintain innate goodness and not the trade-offs we often make as we go down lifes highways.

The movie has it all too,drama,comedy and it challenges societal norms as well. Then there are the almost endless quotes from the movie that have slipped into everyday speech. They are too numerous to say at this point.One of the toppers for me in the movie is when Forrest is in a quandary about life and wondering as Lt.Dan said we all have a destiny and his Mom says it is where we are all just floating around like a feather in the wind. Forrest's character terms it very well with this quote,"I think it is a little bit of both." From my experiences in life it does appear to be that way. So if you have not seen the movie,see it soon you are in for a real treat. If you did not like it, give it a try again and hopefully you will see it for the great story it is!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1857917,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.8},"duration":"PT2H22M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Eat Pray Love
Jedi, moli, voli
programme.desc:
Eat Pray Love: Directed by Ryan Murphy. With Julia Roberts, I. Gusti Ayu Puspawati, Hadi Subiyanto, Billy Crudup. A married woman realizes how unhappy her marriage really is, and that her life needs to go in a different direction. After a painful divorce, she takes off on a round-the-world journey to "find herself"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0879870/","name":"Eat Pray Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NDkyNzkyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDQyNDk0Mw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000849/","name":"Javier Bardem"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0420955/","name":"Richard Jenkins"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614682/","name":"Ryan Murphy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136967/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0087432/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614682/","name":"Ryan Murphy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0759022/","name":"Jennifer Salt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2418691/","name":"Elizabeth Gilbert"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eat Pray Love: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2996176409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTU5MTczNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk0NTM2Mw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTU5MTczNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk0NTM2Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Happily married Elizabeth Gilbert (Roberts) takes a right turn in her life by enduring a painful divorce and proceeding to take a round-the-world journey of self-enlightenment and fulfillment. "},"datePublished":"2010-08-13","description":"A married woman realizes how unhappy her marriage really is, and that her life needs to go in a different direction. After a painful divorce, she takes off on a round-the-world journey to "find herself".","keywords":"emotional balance,indonesia,inner peace,traveling,young woman","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0879870/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ja-br-sa"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crucial point in the story left out in the movie","reviewBody":"Altogether, the topic, the locations, the atmospheres, the acting made me enjoy the movie more than the book. I read the book and found it OK, but not like fantastic (almost like the Alchymist by Coehlo; sort of simple enough for anyone to understand, but deep enough for a lot of people to feel intellectual or in touch with new thoughts). But for the movie I had low expectations, based on the reviews - nonetheless I was positively surprised, though left wondering if most critics are just a bunch of sheep following a path (made by an old sheep who left decades ago)? And hence, obliged to hate any woman prioritizing herself?

The movie deals with a topic that very few (American) movies actually deal with - our inner lives and pursuits for balance and happiness. Maybe because it is difficult, as it is a somewhat stand still, internal journey. But EPL has made it possible by wrapping it into an external journey too. 

But my main point adding to the other reviews: Some of the criticism of the movie is that the main character doesn't seem to have a good reason to be unhappy, and to leave her husband. However, what is dealt with in the book, but not comes across in the movie, is that she and her husband are to trying to have a baby, as is expected by "people" (and by her husband). EG discovers in this process that she is still not ready for children, in fact she never will be. She doesn't feel cut for it at all, and if she has a child, she feel she'll lose herself (her new husband got himself fixed before he met her, so there was never a question about it). To choose away what many women view as a deed to validate their existence; having children, is tough and scary. One will be judged. Also, she knew her husband's expectation of building a family was not unreasonable, making her feel ashamed and different. This is one of the key reasons for her to start praying; to be able to follow her own instincts, breaking the conventional norms. By excluding from the script this realization for the main character, the viewer is left puzzled with what is wrong in this marriage, there is something that doesn't make sense here. Too bad, leaving this issue out, as it would've added another dimension to the movie and increase the viewers understanding of why EG and her husband should split.

I can't help wonder why they chose to eliminate it from the story, whether it is because it would not appeal to conservative American women who after all are the majority of the box office customers for this movie? Or whether the movie creator thought it wouldn't make a difference? After all it made the whole lot of difference to the marriage, and was a impetus for her entire journey.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":91218,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"duration":"PT2H13M"}</script><metacontent="

After a painful divorce, she takes off on a round-the-world journey to "find herself"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0879870/","name":"Eat Pray Love","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY5NDkyNzkyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDQyNDk0Mw@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Biography","Drama","Romance"],"actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000210/","name":"Julia Roberts","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000849/","name":"Javier Bardem","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0420955/","name":"Richard Jenkins"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614682/","name":"Ryan Murphy"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136967/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0087432/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0614682/","name":"Ryan Murphy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0759022/","name":"Jennifer Salt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2418691/","name":"Elizabeth Gilbert"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eat Pray Love: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2996176409","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTU5MTczNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk0NTM2Mw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMzNTU5MTczNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTk0NTM2Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Happily married Elizabeth Gilbert (Roberts) takes a right turn in her life by enduring a painful divorce and proceeding to take a round-the-world journey of self-enlightenment and fulfillment. ","datePublished":"2010-08-13","description":"A married woman realizes how unhappy her marriage really is, and that her life needs to go in a different direction. After a painful divorce, she takes off on a round-the-world journey to "find herself".","keywords":"emotional balance,indonesia,inner peace,traveling,young woman","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0879870/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ja-br-sa","dateCreated":"2011-02-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crucial point in the story left out in the movie","reviewBody":"Altogether, the topic, the locations, the atmospheres, the acting made me enjoy the movie more than the book. I read the book and found it OK, but not like fantastic (almost like the Alchymist by Coehlo; sort of simple enough for anyone to understand, but deep enough for a lot of people to feel intellectual or in touch with new thoughts). But for the movie I had low expectations, based on the reviews - nonetheless I was positively surprised, though left wondering if most critics are just a bunch of sheep following a path (made by an old sheep who left decades ago)? And hence, obliged to hate any woman prioritizing herself?

The movie deals with a topic that very few (American) movies actually deal with - our inner lives and pursuits for balance and happiness. Maybe because it is difficult, as it is a somewhat stand still, internal journey. But EPL has made it possible by wrapping it into an external journey too. 

But my main point adding to the other reviews: Some of the criticism of the movie is that the main character doesn't seem to have a good reason to be unhappy, and to leave her husband. However, what is dealt with in the book, but not comes across in the movie, is that she and her husband are to trying to have a baby, as is expected by "people" (and by her husband). EG discovers in this process that she is still not ready for children, in fact she never will be. She doesn't feel cut for it at all, and if she has a child, she feel she'll lose herself (her new husband got himself fixed before he met her, so there was never a question about it). To choose away what many women view as a deed to validate their existence; having children, is tough and scary. One will be judged. Also, she knew her husband's expectation of building a family was not unreasonable, making her feel ashamed and different. This is one of the key reasons for her to start praying; to be able to follow her own instincts, breaking the conventional norms. By excluding from the script this realization for the main character, the viewer is left puzzled with what is wrong in this marriage, there is something that doesn't make sense here. Too bad, leaving this issue out, as it would've added another dimension to the movie and increase the viewers understanding of why EG and her husband should split.

I can't help wonder why they chose to eliminate it from the story, whether it is because it would not appeal to conservative American women who after all are the majority of the box office customers for this movie? Or whether the movie creator thought it wouldn't make a difference? After all it made the whole lot of difference to the marriage, and was a impetus for her entire journey.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":91218,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"duration":"PT2H13M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paviljon VI
Paviljon VI
programme.desc:
Paviljon VI: Directed by Lucian Pintilie. With Slobodan 'Cica' Perovic, Zoran Radmilovic, Slavko Simic, Pavle Vuisic. A doctor from provincial town in Tsardom of Russia meets his former student in Ward 6, where the story takes place. Impressed by his rebellious spirit and clever remarks, he tends to spend more time with him while also indulging in meditation, only to be ridiculed by his fellow colleagues. Based on a Chekhov's work of the same title." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0174108/","name":"Paviljon VI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ5MTY2MWYtZGRmYy00NWE5LWEwMTYtOTI4ZjgyYTZjM2ZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0674463/","name":"Slobodan 'Cica' Perovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0705707/","name":"Zoran Radmilovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799510/","name":"Slavko Simic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684596/","name":"Lucian Pintilie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076194/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155009/","name":"Anton Chekhov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684596/","name":"Lucian Pintilie"}],"datePublished":"1978-06-01","description":"A doctor from provincial town in Tsardom of Russia meets his former student in Ward 6, where the story takes place. Impressed by his rebellious spirit and clever remarks, he tends to spend more time with him while also indulging in m","keywords":"based on novel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0174108/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sobot"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Would you dance with the madman, over the hills and far away?","reviewBody":"This is a very faithful adaptation of one of Chekhov's best-known stories. Although a Yugoslav movie, with some of the all-time best Balkan actors, it was directed by a Romanian director, Lucian Pintilie, who later made quite a few films that were very successful at film festivals (Cannes, Venice).

The plot touches many questions that have been bothering the humanity throughout centuries; there are citations from Marcus Aurelius, Diogenes and other classical philosophers. What is madness? Can one be in control of his own destiny? Is there any meaning to existence? Of course, we don't get any specific answers, but are left wondering and even (after 90 minutes of listening to the excruciating soundtrack of the movie, resembling the sound of a train) questioning our own sanity.

To conclude, this is not a movie anyone will enjoy, but certainly one to give you something to think of.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Miris poljskog cveca
Miris poljskog cveća
programme.desc: Directed by Srdjan Karanovic. With Ljuba Tadic, Aleksandar Bercek, Olga Spiridonovic, Sonja Divac. A famous actor leaves the theater without reason to live at his friend's tugboat. The people from his surroundings find out more about his move and come to the riverbank, trying to live freely themselves. The question is who found what.

programme.title: Paviljon VI
Paviljon VI
programme.desc:
Paviljon VI: Directed by Lucian Pintilie. With Slobodan 'Cica' Perovic, Zoran Radmilovic, Slavko Simic, Pavle Vuisic. A doctor from provincial town in Tsardom of Russia meets his former student in Ward 6, where the story takes place. Impressed by his rebellious spirit and clever remarks, he tends to spend more time with him while also indulging in meditation, only to be ridiculed by his fellow colleagues. Based on a Chekhov's work of the same title." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0174108/","name":"Paviljon VI","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjQ5MTY2MWYtZGRmYy00NWE5LWEwMTYtOTI4ZjgyYTZjM2ZhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0674463/","name":"Slobodan 'Cica' Perovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0705707/","name":"Zoran Radmilovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799510/","name":"Slavko Simic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684596/","name":"Lucian Pintilie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076194/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0155009/","name":"Anton Chekhov"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0684596/","name":"Lucian Pintilie"}],"datePublished":"1978-06-01","description":"A doctor from provincial town in Tsardom of Russia meets his former student in Ward 6, where the story takes place. Impressed by his rebellious spirit and clever remarks, he tends to spend more time with him while also indulging in m","keywords":"based on novel","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0174108/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sobot"},"dateCreated":"2015-09-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Would you dance with the madman, over the hills and far away?","reviewBody":"This is a very faithful adaptation of one of Chekhov's best-known stories. Although a Yugoslav movie, with some of the all-time best Balkan actors, it was directed by a Romanian director, Lucian Pintilie, who later made quite a few films that were very successful at film festivals (Cannes, Venice).

The plot touches many questions that have been bothering the humanity throughout centuries; there are citations from Marcus Aurelius, Diogenes and other classical philosophers. What is madness? Can one be in control of his own destiny? Is there any meaning to existence? Of course, we don't get any specific answers, but are left wondering and even (after 90 minutes of listening to the excruciating soundtrack of the movie, resembling the sound of a train) questioning our own sanity.

To conclude, this is not a movie anyone will enjoy, but certainly one to give you something to think of.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":184,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

Although a Yugoslav movie, with some of the all-time best Balkan actors, it was directed by a Romanian director, Lucian Pintilie, who later made quite a few films that were very successful at film festivals (Cannes, Venice).

programme.title: Patuljci sa naslovnih strana
Patuljci sa naslovnih strana
programme.desc: Directed by Milorad Milinkovic. With Gordan Kicic, Jelena Djukic, Milena Radulovic, Boris Milivojevic. For 40 year old Nikola, everyday life is just about producing the worst, the most vulgar reality shows and hidden cameras for TV. His life begins to change when he starts to mentor young girl pushed to be star by her ambitious mother. In turn of the events, Nikola starts to wonder if it is he who is the target of some hidden camera show.

programme.title: Jagode u grlu
Jagode u grlu
programme.desc: Jagode u grlu: Directed by Srdjan Karanovic. With Aleksandar Bercek, Branko Cvejic, Predrag 'Miki' Manojlovic, Bogdan Diklic. A story about partly miserable lives of middle aged men and unfulfilled dreams of youth. And about men turning into what they should be ashamed of, during one drunken night." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0089361/","name":"Jagode u grlu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdjMWQ0YjItMTZmMS00MGU1LWEzN2YtOTljY2U5OTIyYjFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzIwMTIwODc@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0073353/","name":"Aleksandar Bercek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194115/","name":"Branko Cvejic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0543547/","name":"Predrag 'Miki' Manojlovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076116/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"}],"datePublished":"1985-05-24","description":"A story about partly miserable lives of middle aged men and unfulfilled dreams of youth. And about men turning into what they should be ashamed of, during one drunken night.","keywords":"one upmanship,success,memory,game playing,band","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0089361/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rbunta"},"dateCreated":"2004-05-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"A sentimental meeting of old friends develops into a night of strange events - funny, sad, often absurd...","reviewBody":"It seems that the period of 15 years out of school benches is enough to recapitulate life, to see where one is. So, school friends Bane Bumblebee, his wife Biljka, Goca, Uske and Boca Combe decide to celebrate the arrival from abroad of their friend Miki Rubirosis. A wild night was planned to be in a restaurant rented only for them, to remember their youth from the sixties.\n\nThere is an invisible thread that connects Srdjan Karanovics films, a subterranean axis that appears to run through his photography. These are characters that are trapped by their own ambitions, or are slaves to their passions; characters who wish to be free of a reality that they cannot control; characters who seek to define their identity: the characters in the films of Srdjan Karanovic are caged in. And perhaps this, according to Karanovic, is precisely the duty of the filmmaker: apart from filming, he must free the characters from their fetters; show them an escape route; help them discover their true identity...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":559,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Igmanski mars
Igmanski marš
programme.desc:
Igmanski mars: Directed by Zdravko Sotra. With Tihomir Arsic, Zeljka Cvjetan, Branislav Lecic, Milan Strljic. Igman March is known as the 'second offensive'. After the fall of the Uzice Republic, for strengthening the grouping of enemies in December 1941, in the small town of Rudo in Bosnia, formed the First Proletarian Brigade, the first regular units of the National Liberation Army of Yugoslavia. One of her first major trials is Igman march known as the 'Second offensive'. In late January 1942 immediately after the formation of the brigade to mountain Romanija found itself in an environment of strong German forces and that would put us in the best great number enemy forces, supreme headquarters in consultation with the staff of the brigade decided that the majority of the Yugoslav partisans must not exceed the Igman mountain near the city of Sarajevo. The task is anything but easy because of the extreme cold and strong wind. The plan was to pass near Sarajevo itself, over Mount Igman, according to the liberated city of Foca, where he broke the supreme headquarters with Tito. The march was conducted on the night of January 27, 1942 at a temperature of minus 40 degrees. The march was after 19 hours of continuous walking and after the horrible and tragic loss yet completed." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0085713/","name":"Igmanski mars","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzJiZWQ4ZTctNDQxNi00NjE5LWI3OTQtN2Q5MDVmODBiOGNmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzMzMjU5NDY@._V1_.jpg","genre":["War"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0037565/","name":"Tihomir Arsic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194159/","name":"Zeljka Cvjetan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0496118/","name":"Branislav Lecic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0815638/","name":"Zdravko Sotra"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0018016/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002790/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1514274/","name":"Zivojin Gavrilovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831223/","name":"Slobodan Stojanovic"}],"datePublished":"1983-06-27","description":"Igman March is known as the 'second offensive'. After the fall of the Uzice Republic, for strengthening the grouping of enemies in December 1941, in the small town of Rudo in Bosnia, formed the First Proletarian Brigade, the first re","keywords":"brigade,offensive,second offensive,supreme headquarters,mountain","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0085713/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Nemanja_Gajic"},"dateCreated":"2005-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"A interpretation of the suffering of the Partisan army","reviewBody":"At the end of January, in 1942. the First Proletarian brigade is surrounded by strong enemy forces on the Romanija mountain.Partisan headquarters brings a dangerous decision,only possible one. They should go near Sarajevo, over Igman mountain, towards the liberated Foca.

The Igman march was carried out during the night between 27. and 28. January, under the heavy snow and cold. That march became legendary, and forty frozen fighters were transfered to Foca hospital. There, they bravely endured superhuman pains during the amputation of frozen body parts without anesthesia or proper equipment...

programme.title: Koraci kroz magle
Koraci kroz magle
programme.desc: Directed by Zorz Skrigin. With Husein Cokic, Bora Todorovic, Milan Srdoc, Vojislav Miric. After breaking the enemy's rings, a partisan batch is left only with three wounded and two healthy fighters. Through his binoculars, the German captain Anders monitors the surviving soldiers who are walking through the fog in an effort to reach their brigade. Anders quietly starts a manhunt on wounded while anticipating their physical and mental exhaustion.

programme.title: Patuljci sa naslovnih strana
Patuljci sa naslovnih strana
programme.desc: Directed by Milorad Milinkovic. With Gordan Kicic, Jelena Djukic, Milena Radulovic, Boris Milivojevic. For 40 year old Nikola, everyday life is just about producing the worst, the most vulgar reality shows and hidden cameras for TV. His life begins to change when he starts to mentor young girl pushed to be star by her ambitious mother. In turn of the events, Nikola starts to wonder if it is he who is the target of some hidden camera show.

And about men turning into what they should be ashamed of, during one drunken night.","keywords":"one upmanship,success,memory,game playing,band","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0089361/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rbunta"},"dateCreated":"2004-05-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"A sentimental meeting of old friends develops into a night of strange events - funny, sad, often absurd...","reviewBody":"It seems that the period of 15 years out of school benches is enough to recapitulate life, to see where one is. So, school friends Bane Bumblebee, his wife Biljka, Goca, Uske and Boca Combe decide to celebrate the arrival from abroad of their friend Miki Rubirosis. A wild night was planned to be in a restaurant rented only for them, to remember their youth from the sixties.\n\nThere is an invisible thread that connects Srdjan Karanovics films, a subterranean axis that appears to run through his photography. These are characters that are trapped by their own ambitions, or are slaves to their passions; characters who wish to be free of a reality that they cannot control; characters who seek to define their identity: the characters in the films of Srdjan Karanovic are caged in. And perhaps this, according to Karanovic, is precisely the duty of the filmmaker: apart from filming, he must free the characters from their fetters; show them an escape route; help them discover their true identity...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":559,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Igmanski mars
Igmanski marš
programme.desc:
Igmanski mars: Directed by Zdravko Sotra. With Tihomir Arsic, Zeljka Cvjetan, Branislav Lecic, Milan Strljic. Igman March is known as the 'second offensive'. After the fall of the Uzice Republic, for strengthening the grouping of enemies in December 1941, in the small town of Rudo in Bosnia, formed the First Proletarian Brigade, the first regular units of the National Liberation Army of Yugoslavia. One of her first major trials is Igman march known as the 'Second offensive'. In late January 1942 immediately after the formation of the brigade to mountain Romanija found itself in an environment of strong German forces and that would put us in the best great number enemy forces, supreme headquarters in consultation with the staff of the brigade decided that the majority of the Yugoslav partisans must not exceed the Igman mountain near the city of Sarajevo. The task is anything but easy because of the extreme cold and strong wind. The plan was to pass near Sarajevo itself, over Mount Igman, according to the liberated city of Foca, where he broke the supreme headquarters with Tito. IMDb data; ttnr: 0085713, Title: Igmanski mars, --- Description: Igmanski mars: Directed by Zdravko Sotra. With Tihomir Arsic, Zeljka Cvjetan, Branislav Lecic, Milan Strljic. Igman March is known as the 'second offensive'. After the fall of the Uzice Republic, for strengthening the grouping of enemies in December 1941, in the small town of Rudo in Bosnia, formed the First Proletarian Brigade, the first regular units of the National Liberation Army of Yugoslavia. One of her first major trials is Igman march known as the 'Second offensive'. In late January 1942 immediately after the formation of the brigade to mountain Romanija found itself in an environment of strong German forces and that would put us in the best great number enemy forces, supreme headquarters in consultation with the staff of the brigade decided that the majority of the Yugoslav partisans must not exceed the Igman mountain near the city of Sarajevo. The task is anything but easy because of the extreme cold and strong wind. The plan was to pass near Sarajevo itself, over Mount Igman, according to the liberated city of Foca, where he broke the supreme headquarters with Tito. The march was conducted on the night of January 27, 1942 at a temperature of minus 40 degrees. programme.title: Koraci kroz magle
Koraci kroz magle
programme.desc: Directed by Zorz Skrigin. With Husein Cokic, Bora Todorovic, Milan Srdoc, Vojislav Miric. After breaking the enemy's rings, a partisan batch is left only with three wounded and two healthy fighters. Through his binoculars, the German captain Anders monitors the surviving soldiers who are walking through the fog in an effort to reach their brigade. Anders quietly starts a manhunt on wounded while anticipating their physical and mental exhaustion.

programme.title: Boj na Kosovu
Boj na Kosovu
programme.desc: Boj na Kosovu: Directed by Zdravko Sotra. With Milos Zutic, Gorica Popovic, Vojislav 'Voja' Brajovic, Zarko Lausevic. On June 28th 1389, at Kosovo Polje, an army of the Serbian Prince Lazar made a stand against the advancing Ottoman forces of Sultan Murad." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0096966/","name":"Boj na Kosovu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODFlZWNhZDYtYjE1NC00NWRjLWFmNDQtODlhODU2M2E0YWEzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958856/","name":"Milos Zutic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691419/","name":"Gorica Popovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104103/","name":"Vojislav 'Voja' Brajovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0815638/","name":"Zdravko Sotra"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076194/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093043/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0800840/","name":"Ljubomir Simovic"}],"description":"On June 28th 1389, at Kosovo Polje, an army of the Serbian Prince Lazar made a stand against the advancing Ottoman forces of Sultan Murad.","keywords":"turk,ottoman,14th century,sacrifice,kosovo","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0096966/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kojidimitrije"},"dateCreated":"2009-07-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Simovic 10/10, Sotra 3/10, Budget 1/10","reviewBody":"Let's start with Simovic's play. It's ingenious. You can see that he's inspired by past events and that his feelings are honest. Every Serb should find something to learn out of it... I don't expect for the foreigners to find it as interesting, but Serbs should find every aspect of the script ingenious, no exceptions. There are some that claim that this movie is not based on historical facts... It isn't, it's based on a play, and play is based on epic literature. Learn to live with it. This script delivers a strong message to every Serb world wide... Directing? Sucked. Camera is bad. Budget is as low as water supply in Sudan. This movie deserves a higher budget and a better director. I respect Sotra for what he is, but he ain't a kind of director for this movie, if you know what I mean. If you're a Serb, or if you're interested in Serbian history, this movie, along with Drina March is just the one for you. Try to ignore the terrible camera work.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2413,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nacionalna klasa
Nacionalna klasa
programme.desc: Directed by Goran Markovic. With Dragan Nikolic, Bogdan Diklic, Gorica Popovic, Rade Markovic. One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, avoiding his draft calls, and refusing to deal with any life responsibility in general. The decisive race on Saturday is only what he cares about.

When an ancient book is recovered by a highschool nerd Stanislav all hell brakes loose involving his classmates who try to stop the evil that has risen from it." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0430582/","name":"Sejtanov ratnik","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0Mzk4NTA2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTAzMjc1OA@@._V1_.jpg","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Horror"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1381996/","name":"Radovan Vujovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1748550/","name":"Stasa Koprivica"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0849131/","name":"Milos Tanaskovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1194496/","name":"Stevan Filipovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0297465/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1194496/","name":"Stevan Filipovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1747873/","name":"Marko Mrdjenovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1926599/","name":"Natasa Vranjes"}],"datePublished":"2006-04-19","description":"When an ancient book is recovered by a highschool nerd Stanislav all hell brakes loose involving his classmates who try to stop the evil that has risen from it.","keywords":"book,nerd,evil,ancient book,vampire","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0430582/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"sp-drstorm"},"dateCreated":"2008-08-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Interesiting mix of comedy and horror.","reviewBody":"Although it was advertised as a horror, this movie is actually a very decent comedy. People who dislike it, usually don't understand the idea behind it. I'd say it's one of those movies with the spirit (like Minje!).

If taken seriously, the story is (although watchable) nothing special or unseen before. I enjoyed watching the stereotypical "Serbian Bad Guy" comments on supernatural and terrifying situations. It is also notable that this movie is done mostly by young talents from the academy and that it features the best visual effect in Serbian cinematography yet. Way to go people!

All in all, I enjoyed the movie, and I consider it one of my favorites. I would recommend it to everyone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1746,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

train,fugitive","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0089941/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Infofreak"},"dateCreated":"2004-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"Strong contender for the best action movie of all time!","reviewBody":"'Runaway Train' is a rare thing, an intelligent action movie, full of both exciting sequences and strong character development. This combination makes it all that much more suspenseful and powerful. For me it could well be the best action movie of all time. Interestingly enough it's based on a screenplay by Kurosawa, but criminal turned novelist Edward Bunker (who plays Jonah here but is best known to most people as Mr. Blue in 'Reservoir Dogs') gets the main writing credit. Jon Voight gives one of his very best performances as Manny, but Eric Roberts is also just great. Roberts is overlooked these days, making too many b-grade and straight-to-video movies to be taken seriously, but boy, back in the day this guy was GOOD! Check him out here, and in 'Star 80', and especially 'The Pope Of Greenwich Village' with Mickey Rourke. Roberts actually scored an Oscar nomination for 'Runaway Train'. Just why his career subsequently went in the direction it did is one of the great mysteries of Hollywood. Voight and Roberts are supported by Rebecca De Mornay, super tough guy John P. Ryan ('It's Alive') and well loved character actor Kenneth McMillan. Also keep an eye out for Danny Trejo in the boxing sequence towards the very beginning of the film. 'Runaway Train' is a movie I never tire of watching. The interplay between Voight and Roberts is wonderful to watch, the action sequences are breathtaking, and the ending is one of the all time greats!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27430,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"duration":"PT1H51M"}</script><metacontent="

contender for the best action movie of all time!","reviewBody":"'Runaway Train' is a rare thing, an intelligent action movie, full of both exciting sequences and strong character development. This combination makes it all that much more suspenseful and powerful. For me it could well be the best action movie of all time. Interestingly enough it's based on a screenplay by Kurosawa, but criminal turned novelist Edward Bunker (who plays Jonah here but is best known to most people as Mr. Blue in 'Reservoir Dogs') gets the main writing credit. Jon Voight gives one of his very best performances as Manny, but Eric Roberts is also just great. Roberts is overlooked these days, making too many b-grade and straight-to-video movies to be taken seriously, but boy, back in the day this guy was GOOD! Check him out here, and in 'Star 80', and especially 'The Pope Of Greenwich Village' with Mickey Rourke. Roberts actually scored an Oscar nomination for 'Runaway Train'. Just why his career subsequently went in the direction it did is one of the great mysteries of Hollywood. Voight and Roberts are supported by Rebecca De Mornay, super tough guy John P. Ryan ('It's Alive') and well loved character actor Kenneth McMillan. Also keep an eye out for Danny Trejo in the boxing sequence towards the very beginning of the film. 'Runaway Train' is a movie I never tire of watching. The interplay between Voight and Roberts is wonderful to watch, the action sequences are breathtaking, and the ending is one of the all time greats!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":27430,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"duration":"PT1H51M"</script><metacontent="

Healthcare professionals, government officials and everyday people find themselves in the midst of a pandemic as the CDC works to find a cure." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1598778/","name":"Contagion","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY3MDk5MDc3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzAyNTg0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000179/","name":"Jude Law"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001752/","name":"Steven Soderbergh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0132772/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251916/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1994243/","name":"Scott Z. Burns"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3924270105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk4NjIxMjc2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjc1NzU5NQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk4NjIxMjc2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjc1NzU5NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An action-thriller centered on the threat posed by a deadly disease and an international team of doctors contracted by the CDC to deal with the outbreak. "},"datePublished":"2011-09-08","description":"Healthcare professionals, government officials and everyday people find themselves in the midst of a pandemic as the CDC works to find a cure.","keywords":"virus,infection,contagion,epidemic,vaccine","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1598778/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alan-chan-158-451491"},"dateCreated":"2011-10-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Go and wash your hands...NOW!","reviewBody":"Now go and wash your hands! That's what you'll be doing after you see this film. Contagion is a frightening realistic procedural thriller about the spread of an airborne pandemic virus, its impact on an ensemble cast of characters played by a veritable 'Who's Who' of Hollywood and the subsequent race to find a cure.

Like his earlier work 'Traffic', Soderbergh skilfully interweaves the various story lines into a bigger picture that breathlessly tracks and encircles the globe. The cast do not let him down. It's impossible to see a bad performance from Matt Damon and once again his role as a grieving father is sensitively and painfully played. We really feel his sense of sudden and unexpected loss as he struggles to internalise the news of his wife's death, disbelieving, dazed and confused. Marion Cotillard adds an international hue to her role as a World Health Organisation investigator whilst Jude Law plays the role of an insidious Australian blogger, who dangerously undermines the medical establishment's attempts to find a cure for his own conspiratorial and financial gains, to perfection. I could go on; Laurence Fishburne, Kate Winslet, Jennifer Ehle and John Hawkes all provide solid support in a starry cast.

What makes this film so compelling is the way Soderbergh is able to show how unhygienic human beings are and how easy it is to create a pandemic. In hundreds of different absent minded ways we touch our faces on a daily basis and in doing so, transfer and spread dangerous viruses amongst ourselves. Next time you're in the supermarket look out for the number of people who pick their noses, wipe their mouths and cough, sneeze and splutter their way past you without any attempts to cover their mouths. They're picking up (and putting back) the fruit and vegetables, handling groceries and even touching your hand when supermarket staff are giving back your card or change! Worse still, a recent survey showed that although 95% of people say they wash their hands, only 12% actually do so and consequently 1 in 6 mobile phones have faecal bacterial on them and 30% of all handbags. I could go on.

Despite a slightly preposterous storyline when Cotillard is kidnapped in Hong Kong, Soderbergh does portray the breakdown of society in an uncomfortably truthful way when people are suddenly and unexpectedly faced with their own extinction and the instincts of self preservation take over. This could have been explored a little further around the world although at all times the story is grounded in reality. Even the death toll of 27 million worldwide in four months has the ring of truth about it and this is due in no small part to the film's chief scientific adviser, Dr. W. Ian Lipkin, the John Snow Professor of Epidemiology at Columbia University. The televised national lottery in the film is something that I could see happening in the interests of fairness and impartiality when the supply of vaccines is unable to keep up with demand when life and death is only one injection away.

At the film's closing credits one thing stands out and that is the unheralded and heroic work of the thousands of doctors, microbiologists, virologists and vaccine researchers around the world who labour night and day to minimise the effects of such a pandemic occurring which might wipe out the human race. If you're a pessimist like me in this age of global warming, massive deforestation, the depletion of the earth's natural resources, the extinction of wildlife habitats, overpopulation and overcrowding, go figure...a pandemic like the one portrayed in Contagion is inevitable (and long overdue according to the scientific world). The only question that remains is how many people will it kill? Anyway, go and see the film – it's a thought provoking and scary chiller that taps into the current zeitgeist."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":288406,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

lawyer","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0109446/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Silverzero"},"dateCreated":"2003-03-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Compelling, engrossing and well acted thriller.","reviewBody":""The Client" is an enjoyable and well executed thriller overall. While the directing, script and overall product are far from amazing and sometimes quite bland, the Oscar level performances compensate for the easily over-seeable flaws. 

Perhaps the child of the title, Brad Renfro, can be annoying in parts he gives a decent enough performance nonetheless. Too bad about the drinks and drugs problem he has today. Susan Sarandon gives another terrific performance, this time as an alcoholic lawyer. Tommy Lee Jones' character doesn't have much to do with the plot but he's a welcome addition to the film, even though. 

While it is easy to find fault with the film it's easier to just sit back and enjoy it. I chose the latter so I thought it was a good, if not spectacular movie overall. 6.8/10."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":62027,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

reward.","keywords":"brother versus brother,ancient china,general,soldier,china","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1319718/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"changmoh"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Jackie Chan At What He Does Best","reviewBody":""Little Big Soldier" is actually an odd-couple road flick set during China's Warring States period. The war drama, spiced with the usual Jackie Chan comedy, has been Jackie's brainchild for 20 years before finally hitting the big screen. Chan had initially planned to play the role of the young general but having aged since, he has to settle for the role of the elderly soldier. 

Well, having seen Jackie as the titular character, I have no complaints. He provides the role with its requisite charm and experience that it is so easy to root for him. A refreshing change from nonsensical comedies like "The Spy Next Door", I may add. 

Jackie plays an unnamed soldier from the Liang State who survives an ambush by Qin forces that decimates the 2000-strong Liang army. The lowly soldier, who feigns death rather than fight, captures a young Wei general (Wang Leehom) and plans to 'trade' him for a plot of land as reward. 

Along the way, however, captor and captive face a host of mishaps, misadventures and plot twists - and they have to team up in order to survive. 

As Jackie's own project, you can be sure of the trademark Jackie stunts and image boosts. Playing a farmer forcibly conscripted into war, Jackie's message (or ego massage) is that war is bad for the people, birds and the environment. He throws in lots of slapstick and sometimes the comedy borders on the ridiculous. 

Still, these are forgivable because it is easy to like Jackie's and LeeHom's characters. They have a sparkling screen chemistry that helps us overlook the plot-holes and lapses in logic. What's more important is that "Little Big Soldier" has a nostalgic feel, reminding us of Jackie's classics like "Drunken Master" and "Snake In The Eagle's Shadow". - By LIM CHANG MOH (limchangmoh.blogspot.com)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":14720,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="
